Detailed Description

A block of plain switches.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

shiftSwitchBlock::shiftSwitchBlock ( uint8_t *  chans )

Create a new shiftSwichBlock object, with the default number of channels.

The default number of channels is set by __channelsPerSwitchBlockDefault__, defined in shiftStepper.h.

Parameters:
*channelsThe array of channel numbers. This must have at least __channelsPerSwitchBlockDefault__ entries. It must be declared static or at global scope, or otherwise permanently allocated.
shiftSwitchBlock::shiftSwitchBlock ( uint8_t  chanCnt,
uint8_t *  chans 
)

Create a new shiftSwitchBlock object, with a variable number of channels.

Parameters:
chanCountThe number of channels that this device controls.
*channelsThe array of channel numbers. This must have at least chanCount entries. It must be declared static or at global scope, or otherwise permanently allocated.

Member Function Documentation

void shiftSwitchBlock::doDevTick ( uint8_t  bytesPerBoard,
uint8_t *  boardBytes 
) [virtual]

Local implementation of per timer tick behavior.

This function manages the per-tick behavior of a block of switches. It is expected to be called from the doBoardTick() function of the board that contains this device.

This function writes the switches specified in the channels array with the states specified in the bit string written with setSwitches().

Parameters:
bytesPerBoardThis tells the function how many bytes of shift register are in the output board.
*boardBytesThis is a pointer to the array of bytes that the doBoardTick() function this is called from uses to write to the array of bytes that is then shifted out to the boards themselves.

Reimplemented from shiftDevice.

uint8_t shiftSwitchBlock::getSwitches ( void   )

Get switch positions.

Returns:
The bit string representing the current switch positions
uint8_t shiftSwitchBlock::setSwitches ( uint8_t  positions )

Set switch positions.

Parameters:
positionsThis is a bit string representing the position of the switches The LSB controls channels[0], the next controls channels[1], etc.
Returns:
Attempt status. This is not implemented yet; it always returns 0.
